    • Method Detail

      • translateValue

        public static ValueTranslator translateValue(java.lang.String value)

      • renameKey

        public static KeyRenamer renameKey(java.lang.String oldKey)
        A migration that moves the value of an old preference key over to a new key. Removes the old key and writes the new key ONLY if the old key is set and the new key is not set. Example: renameKey("color").toKey("couleur")

      • translateKey

        public static KeyTranslator translateKey(java.lang.String oldKey)
        A migration that replaces an old preference key with a new key, translating specific old values to specific new values. Removes the old key and writes the new key ONLY if the old key's value exactly matches one of the values passed to fromValue() and the new key is not set. Example: translateKey("color").toKey("couleur") .fromValue("red").toValue("rouge") .fromValue("yellow").toValue("jaune")

      • combineKeys

        public static KeyCombiner combineKeys(java.lang.String... oldKeys)
        A migration that combines multiple keys by looking for specific sets of old values across multiple keys, and replacing them with new key-value pairs. Removes the old keys and writes the new key-value pairs ONLY if all the values of the old keys match the set of values passed to withValues(). New key-value pairs MAY overwrite existing keys. Example: combineKeys("colour", "op") .withValues("red", "lighten") .toPairs("colour", "pink") // only if hue = red AND op = lighten .withValues("yellow", "darken") .toPairs("color", "brown") // only if hue = yellow AND op = darken

      • moveKey

        public static KeyMover moveKey(java.lang.String key)

      • removeKey

        public static Migration removeKey(java.lang.String key)

      • extractNewKey

        public static KeyExtractor extractNewKey(java.lang.String oldKey)
